short_description.en: $1,000 rebate for a ductless heat pump replacing zonal electric resistance as the primary heat source. Primary unit must be in the main living space.

equipment_standards_restrictions: HSPF2 rating must be 8.10 or greater
other_restrictions: PGE (Portland General Electric) and Pacific Power customers only

short_description.en: Pacific Power customers are eligible for a $2,000 rebate for a qualifying extended capacity heat pump installed by a trade ally contractor.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Must be listed on the Energy Trust’s qualified products list. Controls must be set with an auxiliary heat lockout setting when available
other_restrictions: Pacific Power customers only. Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump control or smart thermostat incentives. Heat pump cannot have a backup gas heating system, only electric.

short_description.en: PGE and Pacific Power customers are eligible for a $3,000 rebate for an extended capacity heat pump replacing an electric furnace.

other_restrictions: PGE (Portland General Electric) and Pacific Power customers only. Must be listed on Energy Trust’s qualified products list. Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump control or smart thermostat incentives.

short_description.en: $1,000 rebate for an extended capacity central ducted heat pump. Must be listed on Energy Trust’s list and be the primary heat source.

other_restrictions: PGE (Portland General Electric) and Pacific Power customers only. Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump control or smart thermostat incentives.

short_description.en: $3,000 rebate for a heat pump for income-qualified customers. Must replace an electric forced-air furnace as the primary heating source.

equipment_standards_restrictions: HSPF2 rating must be 7.50 or greater
other_restrictions: PGE (Portland General Electric) and Pacific Power customers only. If back up heat present, must be electric and thermostat lockout must be set to 35°F or lower. Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump controls or thermostat incentives.

short_description.en: $1,000 rebate for a heat pump. Must replace an electric forced-air furnace as the primary heat source. If back up heat present, must be electric.

equipment_standards_restrictions: HSPF2 rating must be 7.50 or greater
other_restrictions: PGE (Portland General Electric) and Pacific Power customers only. If back up heat present, must be electric and thermostat lockout must be set to 35°F or lower. Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump controls or thermostat incentives.

short_description.en: $1,800 rebate for a ductless heat pump for income-qualified customers. Must replace electric resistance as the primary heat source.

equipment_standards_restrictions: HSPF2 rating must be 8.10 or greater
other_restrictions: PGE (Portland General Electric) and Pacific Power customers only. Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump control or smart thermostat incentives.

short_description.en: $1,000 rebate for a ductless heat pump. Must replace electric resistance as the primary heat source and primary unit must be in the main living space.

equipment_standards_restrictions: HSPF2 rating must be 8.10 or greater
other_restrictions: PGE (Portland General Electric) and Pacific Power customers only. Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump control or smart thermostat incentives.

short_description.en: Earn a $400 rebate for installing solar panels on your home. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Earn a $450 rebate for installing solar panels on your home. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Earn $250/kWh up to $3,000 for your battery storage system. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Earn $250/kWh up to $3,000 for your battery storage system. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Income-qualified households can earn $0.90/watt up to $5,400 for adding solar panels to your home. An approved solar trade ally must install system.

contractor_restrictions: Your system must be installed by an approved solar trade ally eligible to offer the Solar Within Reach incentive.
other_restrictions: You must own and live in a single-family home, manufactured home, floating home, or multifamily residence that is either an attached side-by-side unit or a duplex, triplex or fourplex. You must also meet Energy Trust’s income qualifications.

short_description.en: Income-qualified households can earn $1.00/watt up to $6,000 for adding solar panels to your home. An approved solar trade ally must install system.

contractor_restrictions: Your system must be installed by an approved solar trade ally eligible to offer the Solar Within Reach incentive.
other_restrictions: You must own and live in a single-family home, manufactured home, floating home, or multifamily residence that is either an attached side-by-side unit or a duplex, triplex or fourplex. You must also meet Energy Trust’s income qualifications.

short_description.en: Income-qualified households can earn $750/kWh up to $10,000 for home solar battery storage. An approved solar trade ally must install the system.
Income-qualified households can earn $750/kWh up to $10,000 for home solar battery storage. An approved solar trade ally must install the system.
Receive $100 off qualifying Google Nest and ecobee Smart Thermostats when you purchase online.
Eligible customers can replace their existing windows with new ones with a U-Value rating between 0.27 and 0.23 and earn $1 per sq ft.

equipment_standards_restrictions: U-value must be between 0.27 – 0.23
other_restrictions:
Incentive available for the following customers: 
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: Eligible customers can replace their existing windows with new ones rated U-Value 0.22 or less and earn $1.50 per sq ft.

equipment_standards_restrictions: U-value must be 0.22 or less
other_restrictions:
Incentive available for the following customers: 
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: Earn $0.75 per sq ft for qualifying floor insulation measures in manufactured homes. Income-qualified customers. Must insulate to at least R-22.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Must insulate floor to R-22 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.
other_restrictions:
Existing insulation must be R-11 or less. Incentive available for the following customers: 
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $0.50 per sq ft for qualifying floor insulation measures in manufactured homes. Must insulate to at least R-22 or fill the accessible floor cavity.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Must insulate floor to R-22 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.
other_restrictions:
Existing insulation must be R-11 or less. Incentive available for the following customers: 
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $0.50 per sq ft for floor insulation measures in qualifying homes. Must insulate to R-30 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Must insulate floor to R-30 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.
other_restrictions: Incentive available for the following customers: PGE (Portland General Electric) Pacific Power NW Natural Cascade Natural Gas Avista

short_description.en: $0.75 per sq ft for floor insulation for income-qualified customers. Must insulate to R-30 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Must insulate floor to R-30 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.
other_restrictions: Existing insulation must be R-11 or less.

short_description.en: $0.50 per sq ft of wall insulation. Existing wall insulation must be R-4 or less. Must insulate to R-11 or greater or fill the accessible cavity.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Existing wall insulation of your home must be R-4 or less. Must insulate to R-11 or greater or fill the wall’s accessible cavity. Rim joists must be R-4 or less and insulated to R-15 or greater or fill the accessible cavity. Knee walls must be R-4 or less and insulated to R-15 or greater for 2’x4′ cavities or R-21 or greater for 2’x6′ cavities.
other_restrictions:
No Manufactured Homes. Eligible customers must have an active account with one of the following utilities:
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $0.75 per sq ft of wall insulation for income-qualified customers. Existing wall insulation must be R-4 or less. Must insulate to R-11 or greater.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Existing wall insulation must be R-4 or less. Must insulate to R-11 or greater or fill the wall’s accessible cavity. Rim joists must be R-4 or less and insulated to R-15 or greater or fill the accessible cavity. Knee walls must be R-4 or less and insulated to R-15 or greater for 2’x4′ cavities or R-21 or greater for 2’x6′ cavities.
other_restrictions:
No Manufactured Homes. Eligible customers must have an active account with one of the following utilities:
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $1.50 per sq ft of attic insulation for manufactured homes. Income-qualified customers. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-30 or greater or the fill accessible cavity.
other_restrictions:
Incentive applies only to manufactured homes. Customers must have an active account with:
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $1.25 per sq ft of attic insulation for manufactured homes. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-30 or greater.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-30 or greater or the fill accessible cavity.
other_restrictions:
Incentive applies only to manufactured homes. Customers must have an active account with:
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $1.50 per sq ft of attic insulation. Income-qualified customers. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-38 or greater.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-38 or greater or the fill accessible cavity.
other_restrictions:
No Manufactured Homes. Customers must have an active account with:
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $1.25 per sq ft of attic insulation. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-30 or greater.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-38 or greater or the fill accessible cavity.
other_restrictions:
No Manufactured Homes. Customers must have an active account with:
PGE (Portland General Electric)
Pacific Power
NW Natural
Cascade Natural Gas
Avista

short_description.en: $500 discount on a ductless heat pump with additional heating source. The heat pump must replace zonal electric as the primary heat source.

equipment_standards_restrictions: HSPF2 rating must be 8.10 or greater
other_restrictions: Customer of PGE (Portland General Electric), Pacific Power. Primary indoor unit must be installed in the residence’s main living space (e.g living room).
financing_details: On-bill loan repayment option: If you own and occupy your home and have the work performed by a participating trade ally contractor, avoid the upfront cost and pay for the upgrade via a monthly charge added to your utility bill.

short_description.en: $250 discount on qualifying heat pump controls.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Thermostat must be added to a heat pump and lock electric auxiliary heat out at 35°F or lower. Thermostat must have an outdoor temperature sensor or be web-enabled and retrieve weather data from the internet and listed on our qualifying product list.
other_restrictions: Customer of PGE (Portland General Electric), Pacific Power
stacking_details: Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump control or smart thermostat incentives
financing_details: On-bill loan repayment option: If you own and occupy your home and have the work performed by a participating trade ally contractor, avoid the upfront cost and pay for the upgrade via a monthly charge added to your utility bill.

short_description.en: Up to $500 rebate for qualifying hardwired level 2 chargers, capped at 75% of total costs. Must be installed by a licensed electrician.

equipment_capacity_restrictions: Charger must be on the Qualified Products List.
contractor_restrictions: All equipment must be installed by a licensed electrician
other_restrictions:
Must be a Pacific Power residential customer.
Must own or lease an EV or plug-in hybrid. Must submit a rebate application within one year of the date of purchase.

short_description.en: Up to $250 rebate for qualifying 240-volt home EV chargers, capped at 75% of total costs. Must be installed by a licensed electrician.

equipment_capacity_restrictions: Charger must be on the Qualified Products List.
contractor_restrictions: All equipment must be installed by a licensed electrician
other_restrictions:
Must be a Pacific Power residential customer.
Must own or lease an EV or plug-in hybrid. Must submit a rebate application within one year of the date of purchase.

short_description.en: Up to $1,500 rebate for qualifying hardwired level 2 chargers for income-qualified customers.

equipment_capacity_restrictions: Charger must be on the Qualified Products List.
contractor_restrictions: All equipment must be installed by a licensed electrician
other_restrictions:
Must be a Pacific Power residential customer.
Must own or lease an EV or plug-in hybrid. Must submit a rebate application within one year of the date of purchase.

short_description.en: Up to $500 rebate for qualifying 240-volt home EV chargers for income-qualified customers.

equipment_capacity_restrictions: Charger must be on the Qualified Products List.
contractor_restrictions: All equipment must be installed by a licensed electrician
other_restrictions:
Must be a Pacific Power residential customer.
Must own or lease an EV or plug-in hybrid. Must submit a rebate application within one year of the date of purchase.

short_description.en: Up to $300 rebate for qualifying standard level 2 charger installations. Must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.

equipment_standards_restrictions: The charger must be on the Qualified Products List.
other_restrictions:
Installations must be hardwired. Applicant must own or lease an EV or plug-in hybrid
and purchase and install a new qualifying EV charger.

short_description.en: Up to $1,000 rebate for qualifying standard level 2 chargers for income-qualified customers. Must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.

other_restrictions:
Installations must be hardwired. Applicant must own or lease an EV or plug-in hybrid
and purchase and install a new qualifying EV charger.

short_description.en: Up to $1,000 rebate for a main breaker panel if required to install a level 2 EV charger. Must be at least 200 amps, 30 slots, and 40 circuits.

equipment_standards_restrictions: At least 200 amps with a minimum of 30 slots and 40 circuits. Sub-panels do not qualify.
other_restrictions: Panel upgrade rebates are only available to PGE customers who are installing a  and replacing the main breaker panel to at least 200 amps with a minimum of 30 slots and 40 circuits. Sub-panels do not qualify. The panel upgrade rebate is in addition to any rebate received for the Level 2 charger. To be eligible for this rebate, you must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.
stacking_details: Can be stacked with OR-39 or OR-38.

short_description.en: Up to $5,000 rebate for a main breaker panel if required to install a level 2 EV charger. For income-qualified customers.

equipment_standards_restrictions: At least 200 amps with a minimum of 30 slots and 40 circuits. Sub-panels do not qualify.
other_restrictions: Panel upgrade rebates are only available to PGE customers who are installing a  and replacing the main breaker panel to at least 200 amps with a minimum of 30 slots and 40 circuits. Sub-panels do not qualify. The panel upgrade rebate is in addition to any rebate received for the Level 2 charger. To be eligible for this rebate, you must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.
stacking_details: Can be stacked with OR-38 or OR-39.

short_description.en: $50 rebate on a Tesla Wall Connector or another Level 2 charger that is not on the qualified charger list. Must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.

other_restrictions: For those who use a level 2 charger that does not meet qualifying standards. Must join the PGE Smart Charging Program to be eligible.

short_description.en: $50 rebate for a qualifying EV charger purchased and installed before it was added to the qualified products list.

equipment_standards_restrictions: As of May 1, 2021, all new installations must be hardwired.
other_restrictions: Applicants must be the residential account holder, own or lease an EV or plug-in hybrid, and already have a qualifying EV charger installed. Applicants must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.

short_description.en: Earn up to $25 for enrolling in the Smart Thermostat Program and save $25 on your PGE bill each summer and winter season.

equipment_standards_restrictions: The Smart Thermostat must be an ecobee, Google, Honeywell Home Total Connect Comfort, Honeywell Home Resideo, Sensei, or another option listed on and purhcased from the PGE Marketplace.
other_restrictions: When you enroll in the program, your thermostat will automatically shift some of your energy use away from peak times when energy demand is high. There are typically 8 to 9 Peak Time Events each summer and 5 to 6 in winter. Events typically last 1 to 4 hours.

short_description.en: $4,000 incentive for replacing an electric forced-air furnace with a qualifying central ducted system.

equipment_standards_restrictions: Must be listed on the Energy Trust’s qualified products list. Controls must be set with an auxiliary heat lockout setting when available
other_restrictions: Extended capacity heat pump must be the residence’s primary heating source. Heat pump cannot have a backup gas heating system, only electric.
stacking_details: Cannot be combined with other heat pump, heat pump control or smart thermostat incentives.

short_description.en: $4,000 incentive for installing a ducted heat pump on your home.

other_restrictions: Must currently use electric forced-air furnace as primary heat source. Must be a Pacific Power Customer.

short_description.en: $4,000 incentive for installing a ducted heat pump on your manufactured home.

equipment_standards_restrictions: 7.5 HSPF or higher.
other_restrictions: Must currently use electric forced-air furnace as primary heat source. Must be a Pacific Power Customer.  Incentive applies only to manufactured homes built in or after 1985.
